definitions.definition: activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result.
examples: he was tired after a day's work in the fields
synonyms: elbow grease; literarytravail "a day's work in the fields"

definitions.definition: a place or premises for industrial activity, typically manufacturing.
examples: he found a job in the ironworks

definitions.definition: mental or physical activity as a means of earning income; employment.
examples: I'm still looking for work

definitions.definition: the place where one works.
examples: I was returning home from work on a packed subway

definitions.definition: the period of time spent during the day engaged in such activity.
examples: he was going to the theater after work

definitions.definition: a task or tasks to be undertaken; something a person or thing has to do.
examples: they made sure the work was progressing smoothly

definitions.definition: the materials for this.
examples: she frequently took work home with her

definitions.definition: cosmetic plastic surgery.
examples: between you and me, I think he's had some work done

definitions.definition: good or moral deeds.
examples: the Clapham sect was concerned with works rather than with faith
synonyms: actions "a lifetime spent doing good works"

definitions.definition: something done or made.
examples: her work hangs in all the main American collections
synonyms: deed "this is the work of a radical faction"

definitions.definition: the result of the action of a specified person or thing.
examples: the bombing had been the work of a German-based cell

definitions.definition: a literary or musical composition or other piece of fine art.
examples: a work of fiction

definitions.definition: all literary or musical pieces by a particular author, composer, or artist, regarded collectively.
examples: the works of Schubert fill several feet of shelf space

definitions.definition: a piece of embroidery, sewing, or knitting, typically made using a specified stitch or method.
a defensive structure.
an architectural or engineering structure such as a bridge or dam.
the record of the successive calculations made in solving a mathematical problem.
examples: show your work on a separate sheet of paper

definitions.definition: the operative part of a clock or other machine.
examples: she could almost hear the tick of its works

definitions.definition: the exertion of force overcoming resistance or producing molecular change.
everything needed, desired, or expected.
examples: the heavens put on a show: sheet lightning, hailstones—the works
synonyms: the whole ball of wax "for only $60 you can get the works"

definitions.definition: be engaged in physical or mental activity in order to achieve a purpose or result, especially in one's job; do work.
examples: an engineer who had been working on a design for a more efficient wing
synonyms: put one's nose to the grindstone; informalslog (away)
sweat blood; literarytravail "staff worked late into the night"

definitions.definition: be employed, typically in a specified occupation or field.
examples: Taylor has worked in education for 17 years
synonyms: do business "he worked in education for years"

definitions.definition: (of an artist) produce articles or pictures using (a particular material or medium).
examples: he works in clay over a very strong frame

definitions.definition: produce (an article or design) using a specified material or sewing stitch.
examples: the castle itself is worked in tent stitch

definitions.definition: set to or keep at work.
examples: Jane is working you too hard

definitions.definition: cultivate (land) or extract materials from (a mine or quarry).
examples: contracts and leases to work the mines

definitions.definition: solve (a puzzle or mathematical problem).
examples: she spent her days working crosswords

definitions.definition: practice one's occupation or operate in or at (a particular place).
examples: I worked a few clubs and so forth

definitions.definition: make efforts to achieve something; campaign.
examples: we spend a great deal of our time working for the lacto-vegetarian cause

definitions.definition: (of a machine or system) operate or function, especially properly or effectively.
examples: his cell phone doesn't work unless he goes to a high point
synonyms: operate; informalbehave "his car was working perfectly"

definitions.definition: (of a machine or a part of it) run; go through regular motions.
examples: it's designed to go into a special “rest” state when it's not working

definitions.definition: (especially of a person's features) move violently or convulsively.
examples: hair wild, mouth working furiously

definitions.definition: cause (a device or machine) to operate.
examples: teaching customers how to work a VCR
synonyms: run "how do I work this machine?"

definitions.definition: (of a plan or method) have the desired result or effect.
examples: the desperate ploy had worked

definitions.definition: bring about; produce as a result.
examples: with a dash of blusher here and there, you can work miracles

definitions.definition: arrange or contrive.
examples: the chairman was prepared to work it for Phillip if he was interested
synonyms: wangle it "can you work it so I can get in for free?"

definitions.definition: exert influence or use one's persuasive power on (someone or their feelings).
examples: she worked upon the sympathy of her associates
synonyms: lean on "leave Hank to me—I'll work on him"

definitions.definition: use one's persuasive power to stir the emotions of (a person or group of people).
examples: the born politician's art of working a crowd

definitions.definition: bring (a material or mixture) to a desired shape or consistency by hammering, kneading, or some other method.
examples: work the mixture into a paste with your hands
synonyms: blend "work the mixture into a paste"

definitions.definition: bring into a specified state, especially an emotional state.
examples: Harold had worked himself into a minor rage
synonyms: agitate "he worked the crowd into a frenzy"

definitions.definition: move or cause to move gradually or with difficulty into another position, typically by means of constant movement or pressure.
examples: comb from tip to root, working out the knots at the end
synonyms: edge More"he worked the blade into the padlock"maneuver
wend "he worked his way through the crowd"

definitions.definition: (of joints, such as those in a wooden ship) loosen and flex under repeated stress.
make progress to windward, with repeated tacking.
examples: trying to work to windward in light airs
